question: If A and B are two events such that <katex>$A \subset B$</katex> and <katex>$P(B) \ne 0$</katex> then which of the following is correct?
explanation: <katex>$P(A|B) = P(A \cap B) / P(B) = P(A) / P(B)$</katex> since <katex>$A \subset B$</katex>.
Since <katex>$P(B) \le 1$</katex>, dividing P(A) by a number <katex>$\le 1$</katex> results in a value <katex>$\ge P(A)$</katex>.
